lexUnit.name: slide.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move along a smooth surface, especially downwards, while maintaining continuous contact with it.

sentence.text: Coleridge talked incessantly , and ` in digressing , in dilating , in passing from subject to subject " , he appeared to ` float in air , to slide on ice " .
When we finally stopped the van behind slid on the hard ice and narrowly missed colliding with us .
A cold sliver of ice slid up her spine .
Though he moved silently , the slivers of ice sliding down her spine told her he was close behind .
His rampant pole moved all over her greasy belly and thighs , and when she spread her legs to capture the greasy thing inside her , it slid about like a duck on ice .
The ice beneath him gave ; he braced himself , and slid slowly into the muddy lake up to his neck .
The poles slid glistening in and out of the water as the craft approached and then beached with a bump .
She had desperately scrambled at the shiny sides of the toilet-bowl as she slid into the water but to no avail .
It slides about , and slips under the water .
During each summer 's rainy season , the lake 's waters would spill over its southern rim and slide down towards Florida Bay .
It was raining , thin trickles of water sliding down the window , tainting the air with dampness .
And then they slide down the leaf and into the water .
And it was her Dad 's face that she saw , briefly superimposed on Simon 's , as he slid helplessly down the slimy walls .
The man collapsed against the wall and slid down it making gurgling noises .
It was starting to rain , fat drops slid viscously down the window panes .
He leapt for one , swung around madly , and then half fell and half slid down it .
Cotterell lifted some manila folders , and they slid around and spilled across the desk .
Red-hot rocks continued to slide from the place .
" Let's have him out , " I gasped , and as the young man pulled on the forelegs I supported the body , which slid and toppled on to the tarmac with a horrible limpness .
` Fast moving " glaciers slid forwards in the valleys at 50 m or so per year .
